column4: I just upgrade to intrepid, but for some reason xorg isn't using the nvidia driver,   and nvidia isn't showing up in the restricted drivers list  like it used to.  Why is that?
did you check the release notes
negative :-p
thanks
ok, I installed nvidia-glx-177,  and went back to "Hardware Drivers",  and still don't see nvidia in the list...
right, that's not what I said :)  You were supposed to check if your card was mentioned in the release notes
it  was
did it say that you need to use nv now?
no, I want to use proprietary
I need to get xgl/compiz working
well "want" and "can" are two different things
I understood,  but any idea why nvidia's not showing up in the restricted drivers list?
I think they are working on it.  nvidia needs to release compatible drivers for some cards and the new X
seriously? so I can't get accelerated nvidia working at all in intrepid?
if that's what it said in the release notes about your card, then you have to wait.  It's being worked on.  Check bugs.ubuntu.com, there may be some packages you can test (or not)
fuser
would it be just "lsof /dev/dsp"?
you can use fuser or lsof sure
also, what does « ls /usr/bin/do-release-upgrade » return?
also, what does « ls /usr/bin/do-release-upgrade » return?
see if the wiki is any help
